attributes.action: MCA to be held accountable for their failings to deliver acceptable service
attributes.additional_details: While waiting on the Maritime & Coastguard Agency to process applications, seafarers are unable to work due to the need to send original documentation to the agency - it is normal for paperwork to sit at the Maritime & Coastguard Agency for months before being opened. (As in case of a GMDSS renewal received by MCA on 10th of July 2018 and as of 28th of August 2018 was confirmed as not having started being processed).
attributes.background: The Maritime & Coastguard Agency consistently fail to deliver an acceptable level of service to UK seafarers. Their inability to process applications, renewals and paperwork in a reasonable time period results in loss of income for UK seafarers in an already difficult career market.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You can find out how to make a complaint about the Maritime & Coastguard Agency here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/maritime-and-coastguard-agency/about/complaints-procedure

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
